xxl.core.io
Class Buffer.Slot

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.Buffer.Slot
Direct Known Subclasses:
LRUBuffer.Slot
Enclosing class:
Buffer<O,I,E>
protected class Buffer.Slot
extends Object

This class provides a single slot in a buffer.

The slots are indexed according to their position in the buffer beginning at index 0. Every slot is able to contain a single object. In addition to the object itself, the slot stores an id for the object, the owner of the object and a map of all slots that are owned by the owner of the object. The id AND the owner of an object are stored in order to ease the identification of elements in the buffer. Therefore the id of an object must only be an unique id at the owner but not a global unique id. A slot can be fixed, so that its object can not be removed from it. In order to guarantee highest flexibility, the way of flushing a slot must be implemented by a function. Therefore an owner can specify an own flush function for every object in the buffer.

See Also:
Function, HashMap, Map

Field Detail

index

protected int index
The index of the slot in the buffer. The slots are indexed according to their position in the buffer beginning at index 0.

members

protected Map<I,Buffer.Slot> members
A map that contains all slots that are owned by the owner of this slot. The slots are identified by their ids. Therefore the id must only be an unique id at the owner but not a global unique id. Every class of identifyers has to implement the hashCode method.

owner

protected O owner
An owner of this slot (the object contained by this slot).

id

protected I id
An id that identifies this slot (the object contained by this slot).

object

protected E object
The object that is contained by this slot.

isFixed

protected boolean isFixed
A flag that determines whether this slot is fixed or not. The object contained by a fixed slot and the information belonging to it cannot be removed.

flush

protected Function<Object,?> flush
A function that implements the functionality of flushing a slot. When this slot should be flushed, the function is called* with its id and object. Therefore the function must implement all the functionality that is needed to flush a slot.

sizeBytes

protected int sizeBytes
Number of bytes which are inside the slot.

Constructor Detail

Buffer.Slot

protected Buffer.Slot(int index)
Constructs a new empty slot with the specified index. The new slot contains no object and is not fixed.

Parameters:
index - the index of the new slot.
Method Detail

id

protected I id()
Returns the id of this slot.

Returns:
the id of this slot.

get

protected E get()
Returns the object that is contained by this slot.

Returns:
the object of this slot.

isDirty

protected boolean isDirty()
Returns whether this slot is dirty or not. In other words, returns true if flush != null (the object is not yet flushed), else returns false.

Returns:
true if this slot is dirty, else returns false.

isFixed

protected boolean isFixed()
Returns whether this slot is fixed or not. In other words, returns true if isFixed == true, else returns false.

Returns:
true if this slot is fixed, else returns false.

fix

protected void fix()
Fixes this slot so that the object contained by it cannot be removed out of the buffer.

unfix

protected void unfix()
Unfixes this slot so that the object contained by it can be removed out of the buffer.

flush

protected void flush()
Flushes this slot by calling its flush function with its id and object. This implementation checks first whether the slot is dirty. When it is dirty, the flush function is called and set to null, i.e. the slot is not any longer dirty after calling this method.

update

protected void update(E object,
                      Function<Object,?> flush)
Updates the object and flush function of this slot. The object and flush function are replaced by the specified object and function, i.e. the slot is dirty after calling this method.

Parameters:
object - the new object of this slot.
flush - the new flush function of this slot.

insert

protected void insert(O owner,
                      I id,
                      E object)
Inserts the specified object with the specified id and owner in this slot. Sets the object, id and owner of this slot to the specified objects and updates member map of this slot and the owner map of the buffer.

Parameters:
owner - the new owner of this slot.
id - the new id of this slot.
object - the new object of this slot.

remove

protected void remove()
Removes the object and any information belonging to it from this slot so that it is empty thereafter. This implementation swaps this slot and the occupied slot with the highest index. Then their indices, this slot's member map and the owner map of the buffer are updated. At last, the attributes of this slot are reset.

displace

protected void displace()
Displaces this slot by flushing it and removing the object and any information belonging to it from it.
